description: A blend of wines from different Premier Cru vineyards, this is firm, as befits a Pommard, but has such great ripe fruit that it feels almost opulent. Lovely rich raspberry fruits are touched wit red currants and supported by solid tannins  at the end. Drink from 2017.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: The wine is firm and structured while still having fresh juicy fruitiness. Wood and fruit tannins give a dense core of dryness, leaving the acidity and red berry fruits still developing. From one of the best Premier Crus in Pommard, this will be best drunk after 2018.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012  Vosne-Romanée
description: Richly juicy, this offers a combination of ripe red and black fruits and dark, dense tannins. It's a solid, complex wine with a strong sense of minerality as well as opulent fruitiness. Drink this potentially delicious wine from 2017.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2011 Clos du Chapitre Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: The two-acre Clos du Chapitre vineyard is in the center of the Gevrey-Chambertin village. The wine is rich, full-bodied, full of red fruits, dark cherries and a rounded, perfumed character. It's powerful with its firm structure and complex balance between fruit and acidity. Drink from 2017.

title: Patient Cottat 2013 Le Grand Caillou Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This wine is laced with wood and spice. It is ripe and fruity, also having a strong pepper and toast character and a light sprinkling of tannin. Juicy cherries give a lift at the end. Drink now.

title: Château Margüi 2011 Titien de Margüi Red (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: While rich, this blend of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is also quite herbal in character. Maybe it gets its nature from the wild garrigue countryside of Provence, but its tannins are firm and the fruit is laced with licorice. It should age another year.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: Structured and dense with tannins, this is a big wine with a big future. Its black fruits, acidity and solid texture all point to its weight and richness. It is going to be a rich fruity wine. But wait until 2023.

title: Domaine de Suremain 2015 Les Crêts Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: The Suremain family winery in the main street of Mercurey has cellars going back to the 17th century. This wood-aged wine will have been kept here, where it has developed into a structured and firm wine, full of dry tannins as well as ripe red-berry fruits. Drink from 2023.

title: Château de Santenay 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This is a generous wine with fine potential. Its rich red fruits and acidity are contrasted with dense tannins and spice from the wood aging. It will be slow but sure to develop into a delicious wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Rossignol-Février Père et Fils 2015 Les Angles Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: Fruity and with plenty of acidity, this is a crisp wine, still exposing the tight mineral texture. The red-currant and raspberry fruits are prominent, shot through with acidity. Drink from 2023.

title: Manuel Olivier 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: There is a depth of flavor and concentration from low-yield old vines. The style gives raspberry flavors and acidity, with a light tannic character.

title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Champeaux Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: The wine comes from a parcel that is less than an acre. Vines aged for 45 years on average have created a structured, concentrated wine with powerful tannins and dark, black fruits. It is a wine for serious aging, It's unlikely to be ready before 2020.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey Champs Martin Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: In an impressive line up of Premier Crus from Mercurey, this is the most structured. With dark dry tannins and a firm structure it has considerable potential for aging. The rich black fruits are still developing, filling the wine with fine perfumes and juicy acidity. The wine needs to wait, drink from 2020.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine des Perdrix Les Terres Blanches Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: This is a small Premier Cru of two acres higher up the slope from the main line of Premier Cru vineyards. That gives it a cool mineral character as well as crisp red fruits. The tannins are solid, concentrated and are still driving the fruits. The wine needs to fill out, so don't drink before 2022.

title: Pehu-Simonet 2010 Fins Lieux No 1 Millésimé Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: This single-parcel, partially barrel-fermented Champagne is in effect a Blanc de Noirs. If all that sounds complicated (and so does the name of the wine), the wine itself is much easier to appreciate. It is certainly rich, with a touch of tannin and mineral texture. Full of ripe white fruits, it offers good acidity at the end. It could age longer; drink from 2017.

title: Roux Père et Fils 2006 Beauregard Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: There is a firm structure here underpinning the sweet, ripe strawberry flavors. The wine offers freshness from its berry acidity along with a final tight core of tannins. Age for 2–3 years.

title: Albert Bichot 2007 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines  (Pommard)
description: Fine, solidly textured wine that has some depth of red fruit flavors as well as some sweetness. The tannin edge is on the dry side, with some obvious toast character, giving a wine that needs 2–3 years aging.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2007 Marconnets Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: A wine that reflects the relative lightness of the reds in this vintage. It has a layer of tannins, but they don't suggest aging; they are more a base for the attractive raspberry and red plum flavor, freshened by the acidity.

title: Antonin Rodet 2007 Les Molesmes Château de Rully Premier Cru  (Rully)
description: An intensely wooded wine that is dominated by dark tannins. The red berry fruit is buried under the dry spice and toast character, although at the end there is a more juicy element.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2007 Beaune du Château Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: A smooth, perfumed wine, with an initial barnyard character that then softens into red fruits and soft tannins. Relatively light, going more for juiciness than weight.

title: Evening Land 2011 Château de Bligny  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)
description: Lightly tannic and attractively fruity, it's ready to drink. It has a soft structure, red fruits and a finish that is full of bright acidity.

title: Louis Latour 2011  Chambolle-Musigny
description: This is a beautiful, rounded and soft wine with sweet fruits and gentle tannins. Embedded in the intense fruitiness, a solid structure will help the wine age. Drink from 2016.

title: Louis Latour 2011 Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)
description: In this ripe wine, solid tannins are attractively balanced with red fruits. It does have a cool character from the vineyard, showing structure as well as delicious fruitiness. Drink from 2016.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: From vines close to the premier crus, this is firm and solid while generous. It conveys power and structure along with a more delicious, perfumed side. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine Faiveley 2011 Clos du Roy Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: Faiveley possesses a considerable domaine in Mercurey, including vines in this premier cru. It is ripe and rounded, with jammy fruits and soft tannins. Plenty of acidity enhances red berry fruitiness and the full-bodied feel. Drink from 2015.

title: Domaine Jean Petitot et Fils 2011 Les Pimentiers  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Firm tannins don't completely hide the bright red berry flavors of this full wine. Red cherries dominate, giving a broad feeling even while the tannic structure is still in charge. Good acidity at the end adds to the sense of aging potential. Drink from 2017.

title: Robert Klingenfus 2010 Cuvée Elodie Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: This is a wood-aged wine that has some weight. There's a strong toast character from the wood, contrasting with the ripe plum flavor.

title: Domaine Rotier 2013 Esquisse Red (Gaillac)
description: This fresh, young and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins and intense acidity, mitigated by the ripe, red fruits and smoky aftertaste.

title: Domaine Drouhin-Laroze 2010  Chambertin Clos de Bèze
description: Powerful while still fruity, this shows acidity and notes of ripe black cherry and spice. Very structured and solid, this complete, tannin-packed wine is definitely for long-term aging.

title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010  Charmes-Chambertin
description: Big and concentrated, this is packed with tannins and solid dark fruits. It's powerful with a dark plum flavor and an impressive density of texture. Give it at least 7–10 years.

title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010  Echézeaux
description: Firmly tannic and powerful, this is dominated by a plum skin texture and a spice note. It's dense and rich, with a dry structure and the acidity of the vintage showing on the finish.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2012 Origine Rouge  (Sancerre)
description: A wine with great color, attractive smoky and red fruit flavors and a touch of tannin. It has a good structure as well, reflecting wood aging as well as fine fruit. Drink from 2016.

title: Dauny Père et Fils 2013  Sancerre
description: Pale-colored Pinot Noir that has a jammy character, this is a red fruit flavored wine that is developing fast. It has rounded tannins and a soft texture. Drink from 2015.

title: Château Labastidié 2010 Red (Gaillac)
description: Owned by the Wine Museum of Paris, this estate has 172-acres of vines. This wine is rich, spicy and with mature tannins and red fruits. It is all fruit, ripe and ready to drink.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2012 Collection  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: This is a soft wine with red-berry fruits and only light acidity. Its tannins and perfumed fruitiness are now mature. The aftertaste is elegant and easy. Drink now.

title: Domaine Luc et Lise Pavelot 2011  Corton
description: Still so young, the wine is tight at this stage. It has dark stone fruits and dense tannins along with a lightness of red berry fruits. Power and structure as well as a smoky character from 50% new wood aging.

title: Domaine des Croix 2011  Corton Grèves
description: Firm and solid with great swathes of black fruits as well as dense tannins. Ripe fruits are a major element of this concentrated wine. The wine has power and a firm tannic core, and certainly needs aging for seven years.

title: Domaine Nicolas Rossignol 2011 Roncerets Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: Tight blackberry and blueberry flavors give this wine a stalky, fruity character at the start. It's still very young, very textured, mineral and chewy. Underneath there is a more juicy fruit with a touch of herbal acidity at the end.

title: Domaine des Croix 2011 La Vigne au Saint  (Corton)
description: A rich wine with great fruits as well as structure. It has the weight and great concentration of a grand cru selection. Plum fruits and acidity offer the potential for long aging. It's powerful, while also showing elegance. Age for 6–8 years.

title: Domaine Marc Roy 2011 Cuvée Alexandrine  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This wine has great power and so much complexity, with layer upon layer of fruit and structure. Black fruits give way to a dry, firm end, promising considerable aging.

title: Domaine Nicolas Rossignol 2011 Caillerets Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: This is a concentrated, dark and very closed wine. It has a tight, nervy character that allows you to feel the fruit and the texture that comes from the limestone soil. This impressive, ageworthy wine needs aging over six years and more.

title: Domaine Nicolas Rossignol 2011 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: This wine has a gamy character with spicy tannins. It is rich and succulent with black fruits, but has an earthy texture and is solid and powerful. It brings out both the terroir and the potential richness of a Volnay. For aging over seven years.

title: Château de Sancerre 2010  Sancerre
description: From the vineyards of the grand castle of Sancerre, this has rich red and black cherry fruits, a line of the purest acidity and just the right amount of tannic structure to allow it to age a little longer. It has weight and final ripeness.

title: Vignobles Brumont 2012 Château Bouscassé Red (Madiran)
description: This is the home estate of Madiran superstar Alain Brumont. The wine is big, bold, rich and packed with both fruit and tannins. It has great structure and a dense dusty tannic character that promises great aging. This is a major wine that needs time. Drink it starting from 2022.

title: Alex Gambal 2009 Les Charmes  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: Great density here, with firm tannins and big fruit flavors, very generous and opulent, while also structured. The whole wine is suffused with black plum sweetness. It is also ageworthy.

title: Camille Giroud 2008 Les Vaucrains  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: With smoky aromas and strict tannins, this is initially an austere wine. The fruit remains firm and tight, very powerful, while the final acidity gives a delicious, more juicy finale.

title: René Muré 2014 Signature Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Very pure notes of cherry and strawberry pervade this wine. They are perfumed with a slight conifer scent that spells freshness and lifted ease. The palate has an unforced, elegant concentration. This is charming and fresh, with convincing depth, purity and a lasting, fresh finish.

title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines  (Pommard)
description: With some firm structure, this wine also has great fruitiness. It offers plenty of raspberry fruits, good acidity and a solid texture of tannins. The acidity keeps the wine perfumed and fresh. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Boeckel 2013 Les Terres Rouges Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: With a little airing, this wakes up to reveal dark red cherries held in a taut and firm body that nonetheless has a generous core. There is some gentle grip and frank, firm acidity. It's a very honest wine without any baroque frills—but bags of forthright appeal.

title: Domaine des Croix 2014  Beaune
description: A perfumed village wine, this is made from four different parcels. The wine offers an attractive touch of tannin and spice to go with the forward red fruits. It should develop relatively quickly, and will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Château Bouissel 2005 Le Bouissel Red (Fronton)
description: An intriguing blend of Négrette, Syrah and Malbec, this wine is a selection of the best lots of the vintage. It has purity of blackberry fruit, edged with an earthy, barnyard character. It is ripe, generous, but not overweight.

title: Domaine d'Arton 2012 La Croix d'Arton Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: With vines in the northeast of the Gers region, this winery produces impressively ripe red wines. This wood-aged and spicy wine is still young and needs time to integrate the wood with the red berry fruits. It does have weight and potential richness, so give it until 2016.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2012 Les Peuillets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Beautifully perfumed, this wine is already developing well. It presents a good balance between juicy red cherry fruits and textured tannins that support the richness. It should age further, so drink from 2018.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Structured and dark-hued, this powerful wine is dense with tannins as well as black cherry fruits. It is initially tough, but behind the solid exterior lies a warmer wine, full of delicious fruit waiting to come out. Drink from 2018.

title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: A structured wine, this is packed with tannins as well as dark fruit and flavors from the wood aging. It is solid, backed with a concentrated, dry aftertaste with great potential. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine Rolet Père et Fils 2009 Rouge Tradition Red (Arbois)
description: Completely mature, this lightly wood-aged wine has a smooth, mushroom and red fruit flavor. A touch of tannin gives dryness and delicious, refreshing acidity as an aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine Jessiaume 2010  Bourgogne
description: A red-berry-flavored wine, this has juicy acidity and a light touch of tannins. It's full of fresh fruit flavors, and the finish shows a red-cherry-like crispness.

title: Maison Champy 2010 Signature  (Bourgogne)
description: This is a tight wine, with as much acidity as fruit. The red berry flavor cuts through the crisp texture, which hints at tannins.

title: Domaine de Nizas 2002 Le Mas Red (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
description: A ripe, smooth wine, dominated by vanilla from wood and by red berry fruits. The tannic structure is subservient to the rich layers of mint and herbal flavors, while the fruit dominates. Finishes with chocolate and firm tannins.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Rugiens Hauts Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: This firmly structured wine is packed with solid tannins as well as ripe juicy red fruits. It comes from the upper part of the Rugiens Premier Cru, one of the top sites in Pommard. Dense and needing to age, the wine will be ready from 2023.

title: Louis Latour 2015 Perrières Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Among the most northerly of the run of Beaune premier crus, the wine is structured but the structure is cushioned by the ripe red-berry fruits to give a generous wine. Backed by tannins, the wine will age well. Drink from 2022.

title: Maison Champy 2015 Aux Cras Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: A firmly structured wine, solid with tannins and with structure. The wine is also full of fruit potential, ripe with red berries. It is dense wine that needs to age. Drink from 2025.

title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Domaine Clos de la Chapelle Champs Pimont Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This is a structured wine, dark and firm as tannins meld with the ripe berry fruits. It has the weight to have great potential. The wine, with its concentration and dense tannins, will be ready to drink from 2025.

title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Domaine Clos de la Chapelle En Carelle Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: This is a ripe generous wine with soft tannins and already delicious red fruits. It lives up to the ideal of Volnay, rich and sumptuous, although with an attractive cut of acidity to balance. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Arnaud Baillot 2015 Les Platières Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: This wood-aged and structured wine is concentrated and dense. It comes from the Premier Cru vineyard just to the west of the village. With generous tannins and juicy ripe red fruits, the wine is broad and going to be rich. Drink from 2023.

title: Robert Giraud 2000 Cepages Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
description: Spicy, peppery aromas yield to tomato but not much fruit. The palate is sour, with tart plum and cherry. And the finish is equally lean and tart. High acids and not much fruit equals a lower-end wine.

title: Château de Pennautier 2001 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
description: Bold and very clumsy. There are leathery elements to the nose and wild, grapy fruit that stumbles onto the palate. A wall of tannins hits you on the finish, and throughout it's untamed and overdone. Very fruity and forward, but devoid of tact.

title: Domaine du Moulin 2013 Red (Gaillac)
description: This 50/50 Duras and Syrah blend from father and son Jean Paul and Nicolas Hirissou is a ripe, fruity wine that is attractively mature. It is finely integrated with berry fruits that are lifted by the acidity and given a fine shape by the gentle tannins. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Pascal Bouchard 2014 Réserve Saint-Pierre  (Bourgogne)
description: This is a young wine with a lean texture and stalky fruit from a Chablis-based producer. It feels cool with its acidity and red-currant fruits. Drink now.

title: Cave de Bissey 2014 Le Clos d'Augustin  (Bourgogne)
description: This pale-colored soft wine has attractive fruitiness. Red fruits and a touch of spice are linked with gentle tannins. The wine is already gaining maturity and should be drunk now.

title: Château de Brigue NV Rouge Héritage Red (Vin de France)
description: This is an earthy, rustic wine with tannins that set its black fruit firmly in place. Juicy acidity and black currant flavor give it a lift on the finish. Drink from 2018.

title: Tussock Jumper 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This fruity red wine has firm tannins and juicy acidity. Its soft, rounded aftertaste makes it easy and warm.

title: Louis Latour 2014 En Chevret Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: There are dark tannins here, although they are embedded in the ripe black fruits. This wine is solid and firm, the acidity giving the essential freshness. The fruitiness and the plush texture are taking their time to show. Drink from 2020.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2014 Les Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Perfumed and juicy, this is already an attractive wine. Fine tannins and plenty of red fruits give a fresh and structured character. With a firmer background, it will develop well. Drink from 2020.

title: Henri de Villamont 2007  Grands-Echezeaux
description: A powerful wine, packed with solid tannins, giving rich fruit over the hard, youthful structure. Black tannins and complex bitter chocolate and acidity suggest this is a wine that still needs time to knit together. The final is big and generous.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2008 Les Porrets St.-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Firm and solid, this is a wine marked by blackberries, solid and dense tannins. The concentration will bring all the elements together to give an important wine, while never losing the 2008 acidity.

title: Domaine Parent 2007 Les Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: Soft and ripe, with a sprinkling of pepper and spice, this is a rich, gentle wine. The tannins are open, lying under the lively black and red berry fruits. It will age over the next few years, but is not for the long-term.

title: Henri de Villamont 2007  Clos de Vougeot
description: A powerful wine, offering a dark, textured view of Clos de Vougeot. It is muscular, packed with ripe fruit and a layer of spice and wood. Black plums and prunes provide extra, delicious flavors.

title: Louis Jadot 2004 Clos Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: Relatively light and fruity with tight tannins. The wine has fresh acidity that still dominates the texture. There is a delicious spicy element that edges around the tannic core. It seems firm, not yet ready to soften into middle age.

title: Domaine des Comtes Lafon 2007 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: Full of fruit, this rich wine packs plums and cherries into a style that is sumptuous, with great ripeness. The tannins are soft, sweet and roll well into the rounded structure.

title: Albert Bichot 2008 Les Amoureuses Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: As so often results from this vineyard, this is a lovely wine, the fruit ripe and showing considerable sweetness as well as richness. The structure is soft, open and elegant, surrounding the core of sweet tannins. Not for long-term aging, but worth waiting 4–5 years.

title: Vincent Sauvestre 2010 Les Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)
description: Firm red currant and raspberry fruits dominate this smooth wine. The tannins, which lie underneath, give this round Pinot Noir essential firmness. This needs to age for 2–3 years.

title: Domaine Bernard Fleuriet et Fils 2015 Tradition  (Sancerre)
description: This perfumed and wood-aged wine is so stylish. It is smooth in texture, paced with acidity and shows well-balanced red fruits. The wine finishes with fine acidity and delicious fruitiness. Drink now.

title: André Guichot 2010 La Maladière Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: This is an attractively structured wine, with ripe strawberry and smoky wood flavors. The fruit continues through to the soft finish, which is laced with acidity and a firm tannic core.

title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2009 Cuvée Signature La Mazière  (Fixin)
description: A fruity wine from the lesser known Fixin appellation, this has strawberry fruit, soft tannins and a warm, rich texture. The acidity brings out a bright side to this approachable offering.

title: Patrick Javillier 2011 Patrick Javillier  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: This is a ripe, full and fruity wine that is typical Savigny with its warm red fruits and gentle tannins. It's a rounded, already attractive wine that's full of strawberry and bilberry flavors. It can be drunk now– 2019.

title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2011 Montrevenots Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This is an elegant, smooth wine that draws out the freshness of the vintage as much as the fruitiness. It has ripe, soft tannins, juicy red-fruit flavors and an intriguing smokiness. With acidity holding the wine in check, it should age well. Drink from 2017.

title: Domaine du Comte Liger-Belair 2011 Aux Cras Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Already harmonious, this is a potentially opulent wine with a dry core surrounded by ripe red cherry and berry fruit. At the end, the spice adds a fuller note.

title: Domaine du Comte Liger-Belair 2011 La Colombière  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: Firm in tannins, but bright with cherry fruits, this has lovely youthful acidity. Firmer tannins promise good aging over the next 4–5 years.

title: Domaine des Croix 2011  Beaune
description: A structured wine, packed with red fruits and delightful acidity. There is a core of dark tannin and a solid structure as well as the bright freshness at the end. Because it has this structure, it's worth aging for 4–5 years.

title: François Bertheau 2011  Chambolle-Musigny
description: This wine has great strawberry flavors with soft tannins and sweet fruits. It's fragrant, delicate, and very pure in style, with just a hint of structure and likely to age over the medium term.

title: Mas de la Dame 2011 Réserve du Mas Red (Les Baux de Provence)
description: This is an impressive, rich, smooth wine. Generous and opulent in style, it has weight and firm tannins along with concentrated black fruits. Brisk acidity and a dry finishing touch lend elegance. Drink from 2016.

title: Château de Calavon 2009 La Réserve Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Solid, ripe, perfumed and tannic, this is a concentrated, dark wine. Hints of mint and wood frame rich black fruits on the palate. It is a powerful wine with a good future, so drink from 2015.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This rich and structured wine is packed with both ripe black fruits and concentrated tannins. It is a big wine, a fine representation of this appellation with its dense flavors and aging potential. The wine should be ready from 2021.

title: Louis Latour 2015 Domaine Latour  (Aloxe-Corton)
description: The wine has a good structure with sophisticated tannins and perfumed acidity. Black cherry and spice from the wood are balanced by the freshness of the acidity and the rounded aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Château de Santenay 2015 Les Champs Martin Premier Cru  (Mercurey)
description: Ripe tannins and rich red-plum fruits give this wine a generous rounded character. Bringing out the generosity of this vintage, the wine is a balance between the broad fruits and acidity. In the background, the tannins give the wine extra weight. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2015 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)
description: This perfumed wine comes from the home vineyard of the producer. With soft tannins and juicy red-berry fruit, the wine is straightforward, delicious and very much in the style of the vintage. It has a crisp end of acidity that gives it just the right lift. Drink from 2018.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Romantic Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: This oddly named Cabernet Sauvignon is fine. It has light tannins, a juicy, stalky character, upfront black currant fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.

title: Eric Louis 2016 Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This cool-climate Pinot Noir is soft and gentle. Its ripe tannins and cherry flavors are both lightly structured and juicy. Although still young, it's ready to drink.

title: Domaine du Moulin 2010 Red (Gaillac)
description: A black-fruited wine with a strong sense of structure and wood, it has spice and black-plum flavors that are held together by tannins. This can age for a few years.

title: Mas Sainte Berthe 2009 Louis David Red (Les Baux de Provence)
description: A fruity, fragrant wine, this has good acidity and bright flavors of raspberries, plums and loganberries. It is more fruity than structured and should be drunk now.

title: Antonin Rodet 2011 Château de Mercey  (Santenay)
description: While the wine is structured, it does also have plenty of ripe, juicy fruitiness that is already delicious. It's an open wine, rounded and rich in fruit flavor. The tannins are likely to smooth out soon, so drink from 2016.

title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012 Epineuil  (Bourgogne)
description: Earthy aromas and a soft red fruit ripeness are dominated by wood and smoky spice. They give an unbalanced feel to the wine, not allowing much room for the potential of the fruitiness and acidity.

title: Gala Rouge 2006 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays d'Oc)
description: Simple earthy notes interspersed with faint cherry aromas open this pleasant, good-value Pinot Noir from the south of France. The blueberry-flavored palate shows riper fruit than is typical for Burgundy and may appeal to those who find California Pinots to be a bit overwhelming. Tannins are in abundance here but are fine enough not to interfere with tuna or swordfish in a delicate sauce.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: Produced from old vines in the Aegerter Domaine, this wine is dominated by red fruits and spice from wood aging. It is fruity, perfumed and likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2018.

title: Les Jamelles 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Pays d'Oc)
description: Sweet oak tones frame the black cherry and currant fruit in this wine, with notes of mocha and raspberry sauce atop. The velvety texture offers good tannic grip, while ample acidity helps to keep the palate fresh and the finish lifted. Drink now.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Produced from vineyards in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this wine benefits from the ripe vintage of 2015. It has open red fruit and soft tannins that are both lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, this is ready to enjoy now.

title: Domaine Moillard 2009 Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: While it does have the structure of a Pommard, this is also a ripe, rounded wine. Its sweet red fruits surround the firm tannins offering richness. A wine that will offer sold pleasure in 3–4 years.

title: Domaine Thierry Mortet 2009  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: A beautifully perfumed wine that shows some of the structure of a Gevrey but combines this with dark rich fruits and sweet tannins. There is a smoky flavor that balances the ripe red fruits and final acidity.

title: Domaine Moillard 2009  Côte de Nuits-Villages
description: A fresh wine with red cherry fruits giving a bright character, the tannins soft and with attractive acidity. It is lightly textured and should be ready to drink in 1–2 years.

title: Producteurs Plaimont 2014 Moonseng Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: The producer has the largest nursery of old grape varieties in southwest France and from it has plucked the Manseng Noir to blend with Merlot. The result is a rich wine with ripe Merlot red fruits that are given a more tannic character with the Manseng. There is a fresh juicy aftertaste that allows it to be drunk now.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Belle Canaille  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Vines in the hills west of Nuits Saint-Georges are the source for this crisp red-currant-flavored wine. It has a juicy character, bright with red fruits. The wine will be ready from 2018.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: Soft and fruity, this young wine is full of red fruits and attractive acidity. It has a core of tannins that will soften over the next few months. Drink from 2018.

title: Duval-Leroy NV Rose de Saignée Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: The name indicates that this Champagne gets its delicate onion skin pink from the grape skins and not the addition of red wine, as with most rosé Champagnes. Does this make it any better? It's certainly a well integrated wine, the berry fruits very much part of the overall richness and, the acidity in a great supporting role.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)
description: This is an open delicious wine, full of red-cherry and red-currant fruit with a touch of minerality to add texture. Some wood aging has smoothed out the crisp fruit and added vanilla to the mix. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.

title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: The wine is juicy with intense acidity. Its red-currant flavor is consistent with this acidity. Tannins are firm and will soften. The juicy aftertaste gives the wine crispness.

title: Château la Gordonne 2010 Verité du Terroir Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This ripe wine has jammy red fruit flavors. The fruitiness is given structure by the stalky tannins and the dry, wood-aging flavors. Black cherries and juicy black currants show strongly. It needs to age, so drink from 2016.

title: Domaine François Schmitt NV Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Crémant d'Alsace)
description: Notions of ripe, yellow apple peel signals that this is a more rounded, slightly more oxidative style, boasting a bready, autolytic backbone. With its rounded yet fresh character, this would make an ideal winter apéritif. Savor the beautiful oatmeal finish.

title: Les Alliés 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: Dark fruits—plum, cherry and blackberry—are bold and center stage on the nose, with secondary glimmers of licorice stick and black pepper. The palate offers black fruit-skin flavors that are partnered with medium tannins, resulting in a slightly gripping and astringent close.

title: Tussock Jumper 2014 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This easy-drinking Pinot leads with bright aromas of red currant, raspberry and strawberry hull, all leaning slightly sour. The palate is light and tangy, with tart red-berry flavors that finish clean.

title: Château Bellevue la Forêt 2004 Red (Côtes du Frontonnais)
description: With all the freshness given by the Négrette, this is a red fruit dominated wine, its acidity ripe, touched by candy and strawberries. This is a wine to drink now, with all the crispness of 2004 still in place.

title: Xavier Flouret 2005 Domaine de Châtenoy Rouge Noir  (Menetou-Salon)
description: A lightweight, dusty-smelling Pinot Noir from near Sancerre. The fruit is very soft, with the dryness giving a final firmness to the aftertaste. Flavors of red cherries have a dusty, perfumed character.

title: Château Bouissel 2004 Cuvée Sélection Red (Fronton)
description: A hard-edged wine, lean and mineral in character. It has a juicy tartness to it, the berry fruits surrounding a curiously hollow center.

title: Dopff & Irion NV Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Pale pink in the glass, this has a rather fragrant nose that combines strawberry and citrus. The palate is ultralight and very fizzy, exuberant and fresh while remaining dry and full-flavored. Yeasty autolysis provides backbone and structure, while the creamy citrus elements make for complete refreshment.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2012 Fontanyl Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: Perfumed and aromatic, this fruity red shows a good sense of structure. Flavors include Mediterranean herbs redolent of lavender as well as red plum, along with a dry core. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2010 Clos Blanc Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: This is a hard-edged wine, a typical trait of young Pommard. It has a firm, dry and tannic character, and the ripe, generous fruit sits underneath. Wait for at least five years for this wine to be ready.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Santenay
description: With a proportion of premier cru grapes in the blend, this wine has weight and structure as well as the ripe red-fruit flavors that are typical of Santenay. It's richly textured and full in the mouth. The finish is fruity and soft.

title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Les Petites Lolières Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)
description: Just next door to the Corton Grand Cru vines, this vineyard can produce wines of equal quality. This wine certainly has something of the richness and structure, giving it concentration and longevity. Ripe red fruits are cut by dark tannins and equal acidity, allowing the wine to mature slowly and well. Drink from 2020.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013 Clos des Fèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This wine comes from a vineyard that is wholly owned by Chanson. It is juicy, ripe while having a great, straight line of acidity. The red-berry fruits are still developing and coming through the firm, smoky dark tannins. The wine, with its spicy aftertaste, will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Albert Bichot 2014 Lavaux Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This rich wine is dense with dark tannins and concentrated structure. The vineyard, with cool winds from the valley behind, gives wines that demand aging with their tannins and fragrant fruit. The aftertaste is full of promise. Drink after 2022.

title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This wine is perfumed with cherries and red berries. Its structure, which is certainly there, is almost secondary to this brilliant fruit. Balanced with a mineral dryness, the wine is certainly going to age into a ripe, pure-fruited wine. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine Jessiaume 2008  Santenay
description: Jessiaume is based in Santenay and the wine shows the attraction of this village at the southern end of the Côte de Beaune. It reveals soft fruit, warmed by a jammy layer of red berries and ripe acidity.

title: Tendil & Lombardi NV Rosé de Saignée Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: This intensely crisp selection shows its red-currant-driven acidity immediately. It is a fragrant, refreshing wine, very food-oriented with its dry character. It has touch of toast and a taut, minerally finish.

title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Héritage Rodet  (Mercurey)
description: Celebrating the founding in 1875 of Antonin Rodet, this ripe, perfumed wine has red fruits that are opulent, gloriously drinkable already. It's ripe, softly textured, layered with delicate acidity.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2011 Buissonnier  (Mercurey)
description: The largest appellation in the Côte Chalonnaise produces here a foursquare, solid wine. It has red fruits, although the structure is what is dominant at this stage. There is a dry, smoky, meaty flavor that marches with the final acidity.

title: Domaine Vico 2015 Red (Corse)
description: This is a rich, perfumed wine, with spice from new wood, a rich texture and dense red berry fruit. Its structure and concentration suggest it will age further, so wait until late 2018 to drink.

title: Domaine des Aspras 2013 Les Trois Frères Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: A blend of Syrah and Grenache from organic vineyards gives a herbal, very southern taste to this ripe wine. It is still young and showing both acidity and a firm structure. As it develops further, it will get a rich, full and plummy character. Drink from 2017.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Le Corton  (Corton)
description: This is powerful and rich, allowing just a note of freshness to creep into the firm structure. Dark tannins, black fruits and smoky wood flavors combine harmoniously, lending a sense of great power and long-term aging potential. Drink from 2019.

title: René Muré 2015 Signature Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The nose is shy and does not give much away. On the palate, beautifully pure red currant and tart red-cherry notes come through. The slender body is pervaded by freshness and has lovely overtones of conifer and oak leaf. It is later on that the fine but firm structure comes to bear. This is light but has depth and the potential to develop.

title: Louis Max 2013 Beaucharme  (Bourgogne)
description: This fresh, fruity wine is full of red cherry and berry flavors. A light touch of tannin holds the fruit and acidity together. It's a fine, simple Burgundy, ready to be drunk now.

title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2014 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This fresh, fruity wine also has a core of smoky tannins. It is both structured and offers plenty of bright red fruits. The wine is crisp, ripe with a dry core. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2014 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Ripe and juicy, this is a delicious, red-fruit wine. Its tannic structure lies well behind the generous fruitiness. With a dense texture and good acidity, the wine will be full and rich. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2014 En Genêt Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This two-acre premier cru situated north of Beaune city gives smooth and rich wines. This bottling shows the acidity of the vintage while also having a full, round character, ripe with strawberries and crisp with acidity. The wine needs more time, so drink from 2019.

title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2013 Clos Triguedina Red (Cahors)
description: This blend of Malbec, Merlot and Tannat is lean and austere—probably the effect of the vintage. That gives powerful tannins and less in the way of fruit. It's firm, hinting at more juicy fruit but likely to remain dry and structured. Drink from 2018.

title: Simonnet-Febvre 2006  Irancy
description: Irancy produces lightweight Pinot Noir, emphasizing the freshest raspberry flavors, allied to soft, dry tannins. There is a smoky element here that is attractive. The finish, with its acidity, shows the crispness of this northern production area.

title: Louis Latour 2000 Domaine de Valmoissine Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Var)
description: Smells like Pinot, with meaty plum and fleshy black cherry aromas. Tastes like Pinot, with a supple texture and cola and black cherry flavors. Why can't more wineries turn out good Pinot at this price?

title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2010 Le Rouge Red (Côtes du Tarn)
description: This Gaillac-like blend of Braucol, Duras and Syrah gives rich fruitiness and soft tannins. The wine is juicy, full of red berry and spice and an attractive light touch. It's ready to drink.

title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013 Les Cras Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: A beautifully perfumed wine, this offers a line of fine tannins and brilliant aromatic fruitiness. Cherries and strawberries show strongly against a backdrop of tannins and structure. The aftertaste, still with a hint of dryness, is round with great fragrant fruit. Drink from 2019.

title: Henri de Villamont 2012 Les Baudes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: Smoky aromas hint at a wine with a strong sense of structure and weight. It is concentrated, still full of tannins, dark tension and acidity. Rich strawberry fruits are just a hint at the moment, leaving a wine with power and longevity. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2012 La Brigadière Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)
description: This is an earthy wine that shows a rustic character. Still youthful, its fruit is obscured behind a dry, tannic, burnt-toast character. There is a future for this wine, as it should integrate with age, so don't try to drink until 2016.

title: Domaine Charles Frey 2015 Quintessence Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A darker brooding notion of smoke and tar precedes cherry on the nose. The palate remains slender but has backbone and grip. There is depth here and potential. Give this some bottle age: with a little time it will put on flesh. For now it is lithe and refreshing. Drink now through 2022.

title: Terre de Vignerons 2016 Le Phare Cabernet Sauvignon Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlantique)
description: Pure Cabernet Sauvignon, this wines comes from the same region as Bordeaux. It has black currant flavors, balanced acidity and a touch of wood aging. Drink from 2018.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 Villa de Cocagne Red (Vin de France)
description: This blend of Merlot, Tannat and Syrah comes from the southwest near the Atlantic Ocean. That locale gives the tannins and the juicy red fruits a cool, perfumed and lightly stalky character. The acidity is right there along with the soft berry aftertaste that makes the wine drinkable now.

title: L'original French Kiss NV Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: Ripe red berries, cherries and plums lead the bouquet of this friendly and approachable red. Those notes follow through to the creamy palate, while accents of carnation and pressed violet petals add depth and interest. A hint of sweet spice accents the finish.

title: Le Pépin 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This is a direct but tasty and well-balanced Pinot, with vibrant aromas and flavors of juicy cherry, blueberry and wild strawberry, all graced by hints of purple flowers and sweet spice. The mouthfeel is soft yet structured, with delicate tannins and a slight lushness that lingers on the finish.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2012  Pommard
description: Some firm tannins lie at the back of this dry, solid wine. It has dark plum fruits, juicy acidity and a fresher aftertaste. It's balanced and needs a little aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Manuel Olivier 2011  Chambolle-Musigny
description: Fresh and juicy, this is a soft and rounded wine. It has gentle tannins, along with stylish acidity and red fruit flavors. Already, it is becoming drinkable, so don't expect the wine to age over the long term. Drink from 2016.

title: Domaine Petroni 2014 Red (Corse)
description: This is an attractively ripe blend of Niellucciu, Syrah and Grenache. Softly textured with a warm backdrop of blackberry fruit, the wine is spicy and has a distinctly southern-France feel. Its softness means it is ready to drink now.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2012 Les Mouchottes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Set at 1,000 feet, the vineyard of Les Mouchottes inevitably produces cool and crisp wines with tangible acidity and strong red currant fruitiness. It's attractive and light, with a bright, fragrant aftertaste. Drink from 2016.

title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012  Irancy
description: This is a warm and round wine from Irancy, southwest of Chablis. Red fruits are sustained by some wood aging that smoothes out the stalky texture and spice. It's a wine that could age another couple of years to soften it further.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2012  Volnay
description: While it does have some of the typical Volnay plumpness, this is a light wine that offers sweet strawberry fruits and a strand of acidity. At the end, red currant acidity delivers an attractive fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2016.

title: Domaine d'Escausses 2012 La Vigne Blanche Red (Gaillac)
description: The “blanc” in the name refers to the white grapes historically planted in this vineyard. Now the vines are a varied red blend of Syrah, Fer Servadou, Merlot and Duras. Seventh-generation winemaker Jean-Marc Balaran creates a fruity, structured wine that is well-balance. Touches of spice from the wood aging complement the smoothness of the wine with its light, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Labastide Orliac 2010 Red (Brulhois)
description: This small appellation is situated on the south and north banks of the Garonne river near Agen. Using grapes from three-year-old vines, this wine is ripe and juicy in red fruit flavors, with layering acidity that gives a fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2018.

title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Chaillots Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)
description: The wine is dense with fine concentration and a solid dry tannin character at the back. It is full of black fruits and balanced acidity. Its richness reflects the quality of the vintage and its aging potential. Drink from 2022.

title: Château de Santenay 2015  Pommard
description: This is a ripe wine, soft on the normal tannins of this appellation and big on the black-cherry and berry fruits. It does have a firm core, cushioned by the generous fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2020.

title: Denis Père et Fils 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: A ripe and full wine, packed with fruit. It has a toasty character, spice and bright red-berry fruits that give the wine its crisp acidity and balance the riper smooth texture that is developing. Give this wine until 2022.

title: Maurice Ecard 2009 Les Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Soft and ripe, this is a broad wine. Its tannins are enveloped by the rich plum and damson fruit flavors. It combines the richness of the vintage with the softness of a Savigny in an already delicious whole.

title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)
description: This fresh wine is all about fruit. Soft tannins and attractive strawberry flavors are lightly cut with acidity. Coming from vines between 50 and 60 years of age, it has some extra concentration. Drink this fragrant wine now.

title: Louis Jadot 2014 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: This premier cru, surrounded by grand cru vineyards, has produced a luscious, ripe wine. It's generous in both black fruit flavor and structure, showing great potential for aging. Drink from 2021.

title: Hugel 2009 Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Hugel has always made a benchmark Pinot Noir. This has weight and richness. It does have a strong wood content that provides some bitterness, though it is rounded out by the note of ripe red plum, lifted by final acidity.

title: Domaine Loew 2013 Westhoffen Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: As often in Alsace Pinot Noir, the wine has too much wood for its fruit. What fruitiness it has—bitter cherries and red berries—is smothered by high toast giving a dry, edgy aftertaste.

title: Domaine Ehrhart 2012 Domaine Saint-Rémy Barrique Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Definitely wood-aged, this seriously toasty wine seems to have lost its fruit along the way. It gives a hard and tough character that is partly redeemed by juicy acidity at the end.

title: Domaine Vincent Stoeffler 2012 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A red wine that relies on its fruitiness to succeed. Red berries and plums show strongly, aided by acidity. The texture has a stalky character with a bitter green herb aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château de Tigné 2014 Gerard Depardieu Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: With its attractive red-fruit flavors, this is a light, perfumed wine. It has spice, fine acidity and a smooth texture that is just lifted by tannins. Drink now.

title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Petits Crais  (Fixin)
description: This is a ripe, smoky and generous wine. It has spice and wood flavors that are balanced with the red berry and cherry fruits and the crisp acidity of the vintage. With its rich character, it will age gently over the next few years and be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Clos Venturi 2014 Red (Corse)
description: This ripe, rich wine is full of fruit. Sweet tannins have merged with the blackberry fruits, making it structured and dense. Spice, balancing acidity and a dark, firm aftertaste all promise further aging. Drink from 2018.

title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Chassagne-Montrachet
description: In the past, there was much more red wine than white wine produced in Chassagne-Montrachet. This firm, tannic wine, with its austere fruit, shows a similarity to Pommard. This is a wine that needs to age for over several years in order for it to soften and become round, and for the red berry fruit to surface.

title: Albert Bichot 2010 Les Charmes  (Santenay)
description: A fruity wine, this has exuberant red-berry flavors that suggest this wine can be consumed now. Gentle tannins balance the fine acidity and rich, warm texture.

title: Boeckel 2014 Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Very faint notes of red berry are supported by floral overtones on the nose. The palate has pleasantly bitter elements that enhance the yeasty notes of bread crust. The body remains light while the finish is dry and balanced.

title: Bott Frères NV Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Creamy notes of Red Delicious apple are tinged with hints of shortbread on the nose. These become more forward on the creamy palate as the frothy mousse amplifies them. This is dry, restrained and elegant with a wonderfully refreshing finish.

title: Roche de Bellene 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Savigny-lès-Beaune often shows the softer side of Pinot Noir. This wine has juicy red-cherry and raspberry flavors that balance the gentle, dry tannins. The low-yielding old vines from which the fruit was sourced give this selection extra concentration. This will benefit from medium-term aging.

title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2010 Vaudenelles  (Marsannay)
description: Located on a high slope in Marsannay, the Vaudenelles Vineyard creates structured wines. This selection has a beautiful perfumed character, and it offers delicious red-berry flavors and lively acids that are striated by minerality.

title: Domaine Jessiaume 2010 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: This is a smooth and polished wine, with herb and new wood aromas. It has juicy red-berry flavors, and the tannins push forward. Structured, with intense acidity, this is ready to age for at least 5–6 years.

title: Domaine Sylvain Pataille 2010 L'Ancestrale  (Marsannay)
description: An old-vine wine, this is powerful, concentrated and impressively dense for a Marsannay. It is full of red plum and berry flavors, plus firm tannins that suggest this could age for several years.

title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Aux Combottes Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This wine comes from a vineyard surrounded by Grand Crus. It delivers a huge, smoky palate that is firm with tannins and dense with structure and fruit. The wine is rich, still shot through with the freshness of the vintage. Black fruits are balanced by the dry core of the wine. It will age well, and should not be drunk before 2022.

title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This wine is already well balanced. Ripe strawberries and red cherries are shot through with the acidity of the vintage. The tannins are present, complementing the already attractive fruits. The aftertaste shows the considerable potential with its tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes  (Corton)
description: One-quarter of the Clos des Maréchaudes is classified Grand Cru, as the soil and the slope change. This shows in the power of the wine with its smoky tannins and dark character. Black fruits and a dense texture signify a wine with power and longevity. Drink from 2022.

title: Camille Giroud 2008 Aux Cras  (Beaune)
description: With crushed strawberry and caramel flavors, this is relatively light wine, though elegant and pierced with acidity. Milk chocolate and soft tannins complete an attractive ensemble.

title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Les Pezerolles Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: The relatively unknown Pezerolles Vineyard is at the far northern end of Pommard, touching Beaune above Les Epenots. It produces wine that seems softer than many Pommards, with rich fruit, the tannins firm but definitely playing second fiddle. It is the smoky plum fruit with just a dash of acidity that makes this immensely pleasing.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: With its sweet wood, dense fruit and jammy character, this is a rich wine. It has some solid tannins, but they are almost lost in the welter of soft strawberry, nutmeg and juicy red berries. Typically with 2005, this is a wine whose opulence appeals now, but those tannins do suggest some good aging.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2006 Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Light in color, this rejoices in its perfumed character as much as its fruit. There is a heady smoky aroma, while the palate shows a leaner character. The fruit flavors of red berries are given an extra dimension by the smoky wood and the meaty edge.

title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: The instant appeal of seductive Pinot Noir is here, with its ripe fruits that are poised between sweetness and a pure line of acidity. The fruit is juicy, but always fresh, with wild strawberry flavors and just some spice from wood.

title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)
description: Exhibiting all the ripeness and richness of an Aloxe-Corton, this wine revels in delicious raspberry fruits, topped with red currant acidity. The wine rolls around the mouth, with a velvet texture on top of some firm tannins. There is a complex sweet and sour aftertaste, as the ripe fruit combines with fresh acidity.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2006 Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Soft, sensuous, this is a wine that appeals straight away to the senses. The red fruits float over a soft texture of sweet tannins, leaving a juicy, succulent texture. While it is not a powerful wine, it offers all the delicious characters of Pinot Noir.

title: Capitain-Gagnerot 2013 Les Moutottes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)
description: This comes from one of the Premier Crus that line the lower slopes of the hill of Corton. It has weight, richness and a densely tannic character that promises aging. Its packed red fruits are cut with juicy acidity as well as a firmer structure and dark-berry flavors. This finely perfumed wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.

title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Chambolle-Musigny
description: This wine is soft, with attractive, aromatic red fruits. It has the round, ripe feel typical of the village, with just a tannic touch to keep it together. At the moment, the wine is all fruit and acidity, and it needs to develop further to bring out its secondary flavors. Drink from 2017.

title: Michel et Joana Ecard 2014 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Rather lean and austere, this is a tight, structured wine. Its future lies in the firm tannins and the juicy red-currant fruit. Wait for this wine and don't drink before 2020.

title: De Venoge NV Princes Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Bottled in a replica of a 19th-century crystal carafe, this wine is a blend of crus from the Montagne de Reims. On the dry side of brut, it has a lively sliced apple and citrus character as well as refreshing, lively acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: De Venoge NV Princes Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: A crisp, red-currant flavored wine, this offers bright acidity and an attractive tangy texture. In its hallmark De Venoge carafe bottle, it is pure Pinot Noir with the addition of red wine from Pinot Noir to give its pale salmon-pink color. Drink now.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2008 Château Baron Red (Gaillac)
description: A blend of Syrah and Braucol from the slopes above Gaillac, this fruity, friendly wine has notes of spice and red berry. It's attractively juicy, with soft tannins, and it's ready to drink now.

title: Cave de Hunawihr NV Calixte Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Crémant d'Alsace)
description: This light pink wine is warm, ripe and red-fruit flavored. It is soft and creamy with just the right amount of acidity. There's a refreshing, light aftertaste.

title: Willm NV Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Crémant d'Alsace)
description: With just a touch of bitterness and structure, this is a finely textured wine. It has plenty of fresh red and white fruit flavors, a lively, busy mousse and a tight acidity on the finish.

title: Maison Champy 2006 Les Champs Pimont Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: This wine has distinct acidity, probably too much. Red currant fruits dominate, giving the wine elegance, but also showing some unripe fruit flavors and a texture that is too light and unfocused.

title: Michel Picard 2006  Bourgogne
description: A light, fresh wine, with flavors of crushed strawberries. There is sweetness, softness, and a rounded aftertaste. Screwcap.

title: Domaine Poulleau Père et Fils 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Volnay)
description: Old vines always add some concentration to a wine, and this firm and dark wine is no exception. It's also juicy and fruity with a full character that is already attractive but should age well over 4–5 years.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2011  Volnay
description: The wine has weight, and dense tannins at this stage. What does give it a hint of Volnay's generosity is the warm, full fruit that is behind the structure. It's obviously going to need at least three years to soften out into a more rounded wine.

title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Domaine des Perdrix  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: Structured wine, with firm tannins as well as a light touch of wood aging. It's a fruity wine, raspberry fruit cut with taut acidity. It can be drunk now for its fruitiness, but would be better allowing the tannins to soften. So drink from 2015.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012  Bourgogne
description: This wine is soft, with a light fruitiness and earthy flavors typical of some Pinot Noir. The tannic element gives a dry core to this simple, fruity wine. Drink now.

title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2011 Clos Blanc Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: A structured wine, it has the weight and the firm tannins to give it aging potential. Black cherries, dark fruits and juicy acidity are paired with the drier tannic structure, amking for a smooth and rich wine. Drink from 2016.

title: René Muré 2011 Clos Saint Landelain Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Light, fruity, packed with strawberries, this is an attractive Pinot Noir. The only spoiler is the over-excited use of wood which is masking the fruit and will always be an important factor.

title: Romantic 2014 Authentic & Chic Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: The medium-intense nose of this solid and easy-to-like Cab offers scents of blackberry, cassis and plum, all laced by hints of cocoa and cigar box. The medium-weight mouth offers a pleasant texture, thanks to moderate tannins and ample acidity, with solid black-fruit flavors at the core.

title: Louis Jadot 2014  Corton-Pougets
description: This wine produced from vines on the Corton hill is dense and dark, with great power and concentration. Its rich, dark fruit is paired with intense, juicy acidity, ensuring slow development over many years. Drink from 2025.

title: Le Rouge de Saint-Louis 1998 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: Sure it's oaky, but it tastes good, with the subtle menthol and bold vanilla flavors serving to highlight bright cherries. The silky texture is a highlight, then the finish shows off juicy fruit and fine tannins.

title: Pierre André 2007 Clos de Chagnots  (Ladoix)
description: Ladoix is a forgotten Burgundy village that can offer good value. This wine with its strawberry fruits and gentle tannins fits the bill. There is a fine, ripe feel to it, and a dry edge that sets off the fruitiness.

title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2009 La Brigardière Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)
description: There is some weight on this young tasting wine. The tannins are beginning to allow the red berry and damson fruits to open up. Touches of wood round it out for aging.

title: Domaine Poulleau Père et Fils 2011  Bourgogne
description: There's a kick of dry tannin behind this otherwise ripe wine. Raspberry flavors, red plum skins and a some bitterness add fruit and structure. It needs a year to soften out.

title: Manuel Olivier 2010  Bourgogne
description: A lightly perfumed wine, this is soft with warm strawberry flavors. The acidity and texture play a supporting role in this ripe, light-bodied wine.

title: Frey-Sohler 2009 Fleur de Granit Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: This tight wine has intense acidity, smoky tannins, a light texture and an attractive strawberry-jelly-flavored finish.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)
description: Still firm, this wine is dominated by tannin and dark fruit, with a dry core typical of this Pommard vineyard. The red and dark plum-fruit flavors are developing slowly and the wine needs time to balance. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine d'Arton 2014 La Croix d'Argon Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This blend of Bordeaux grapes with Syrah is rich and spicy. It is made to be drunk young, with touches of toast and a dense texture that brings out the perfumed character of Syrah balanced with Bordeaux structure. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from late 2016.

title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Le Renard  (Givry)
description: Fragrant wine, ripely perfumed, its tannins bringing out red berry fruits and a shapely structure. It also has a fresh feel to it from the intense acidity at the end. Age for a year, but drink now.

title: Domaine de la Pousse d'Or 2009 Clos Tavannes  (Santenay)
description: Dark chocolate notes join acidity and ripe black fruit flavors. The wood is dominant in this relatively soft wine, although the fruit juiciness comes through well to finish.

title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: This is a juicy, fruit-forward selection, boasting vibrant notes of red cherry, raspberry and strawberry on the nose and mouth. A hint of vanilla adds a sweetness to the finish, which otherwise ends clean and mouthwatering. Drink now.

title: Charles Sparr 2013 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The wine is lean, with more acidity than fruit. It does have a tannin edge that gives it structure but the fact the wine wasn't aged in wood means it lacks any depth. Drink now.

title: Domaine Bart 2014 Grandes Vignes  (Marsannay)
description: This wine is well poised between structure and fresh red fruits. A dark side of firm tannins gives a dry core to the wine, while the bright red-berry fruit is perfumed and fresh. The two elements are integrating well. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine des Corbillières 2010 Les Demoiselles Red (Touraine)
description: This blend of Cabernet France, Malbec and Pinot Noir shows the eclectic range of red grapes at the disposal of a Touraine vigneron. It has also produced a soft, gently tannic wine with perfumed fruits, bitter cherry and a herbal aftertaste.

title: Domaine Roblin 2010 Grande Côte de la Vallée  (Sancerre)
description: Light Pinot Noir showing an undergrowth aroma, red fruits, soft tannins and a smooth texture. It's not a wine for aging, attractive now with its rounded aftertaste.

title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)
description: This has ripe red fruits and soft, integrated tannins, with concentration and a voluptuous exterior. This will be ready to drink soon.

title: Domaines Devillard 2010 Domaine des Perdrix Les 8 Ouvrées Aux Perdrix Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)
description: While wood aromas are prominent now, this ultimately showcase the ripe red fruits that lie underneath. It has a solid core of tannins, which is balanced by the juicy fruit. Age for 6–7 years.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2009 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: This is rich, complex and full of ripe fruit. A firm structure underlies the richness, lending concentration and density. The fruit is still reticent and will show more generously in another year. Age for five years.

title: Albert Bichot 2011  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: Already dense, this wine seems to lack fruit. The tannins dominate at the moment along with acidity. It's likely to remain quite a tight.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2012 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: From a half-acre parcel, this is a delicately structured wine. Delicious, forward red-cherry fruits are juicy and provide lift to the the firm tannins. The combination and balance of the fruit and the texture result in a wine that will age well. Drink from 2018.

title: Pierre Sparr NV Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Bright pink in the glass, the nose is full of bruised apple-peel hints. The frothy palate then majors on ripe juicy red-apple flavors and boosts them with bubbly foam. The finish is dry and very refreshing.

title: Pierre Gruber 2014  Bourgogne
description: This light-colored wine is attractively perfumed but with a grassy edge that suggests the fruit was underripe. Built for the short term, it will be ready from late 2017.

title: Manuel Olivier 2009  Bourgogne
description: An attractively simple, fruity Pinot Noir. It has ripe wild strawberry and red plum flavors, spiced with a gamy edge. The wine has a light structure, and is not for aging.

title: Manuel Olivier 2008  Hautes Côtes de Nuits
description: Light Pinot Noir, with crisp raspberry flavors. The very fruity wine has an edge of bitterness to go with the acidity.

title: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2010 Estela Vintage Red (Vin de Liqueur)
description: A fortified blend of Tannat and Malbec, this is a ripe and sweet, styled like a vintage Port. It has a powerful structure from the two tannic grapes in the blend, along with ripe damson fruit and spice, with acidity on the finish.

title: Henri de Villamont 2010  Clos de Vougeot
description: This is a seriously structured, impressive wine that comes from a parcel in the center of the Clos de Vougeot. It is firm and solid—a powerhouse of richness and density—with dark tannins, ripe black fruits and tight acidity. With this kind of structure, the wine certainly needs to age, so don't drink before 2017.

title: Henri de Villamont 2010  Corton Les Renardes
description: Firmly tannic still, this wine is fully ripe, rich and structured. Considerably powerful, it's full of red fruits and dark plums cut with a fine line of acidity. Finishes fresh, with sweet tannins that linger. Drink this fine wine from 2017.

title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: While soft and opulent initially, this wine reveals a structured, mineral character on the palate. Ripe red cherry and black plum flavors pair well with firm, dry tannins and hints of wood aging. This is an elegant wine that needs aging. Don't drink before 2017.

title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
description: Dominated by red-currant fruits, this is a soft wine with tannins in the background. It has a toasty edge from the wood aging while leaving most of the singing to the fruit. Drink from 2021.

title: Roche de Bellene 2014  Corton
description: While the color of this wine is light, the intensity and the structure are not. It comes from 30-year-old vines, planted densely that gives the wine huge concentration. It is firm full of tannins that lie over the ripe fruit. As it develops, this wine will be sumptuous, ripe and impressive. Wait until 2023.

title: Derey Frères 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Fixin)
description: Fixin, the northernmost red wines on the Côte de Nuits, generally produces light wines. This is no exception; the wine is bright, very fresh, with hints of berry fruits.

title: Jean Josselin NV Audace Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Bright pink in color, this rosé is full in the mouth with red berry flavors and intense acidity. A touch of bitterness gives a sharp aftertaste.

title: Camille Giroud 2008 Les Crais  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: For a Gevrey, this wine emphasizes softness rather than structure. It does have good depth of flavor and is full of acidity and red berry fruits. The wine offers pleasure now, while having medium-term aging potential.

title: Domaine Bertagna 2008 Les Beaux-Monts  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: Pure, generous, red cherry fruit scintillates over a structured wine that has dense tannins and texture. The whole is pierced with the dominant acidity of 2008.

title: Alex Gambal 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: Smoky aromas introduce a wine that is structured and concentrated, with intense fruit and acidity. Firm tannins, a subtle touch of wood and fine richness all combine mellifluously.

title: Les Vins Skalli 2006 Robert Skalli South of France Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays de l'Ile de Beauté)
description: Produced from grapes from the island of Corsica, this soft, open Pinot Noir has some pleasing fresh berry fruits, hints of strawberries and soft tannins. Ready to drink now.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2011 Trois Châteaux Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: This soft, ripe Pinot Noir manages to balance the fragrant red fruits with a gentle massage of wood aging. A firm layer of tannins gives structure and it is ready to drink.

title: Alex Gambal 2009 Bourgogne Pinot Noir  (Bourgogne)
description: Rich, sweet and soft, with a strawberry jam character, and just the right balance of acidity.

title: Manuel Olivier 2011  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: Retaining a good sense of structure, this is also a relatively light and fresh Gevrey-Chambertin. It has plenty of raspberry and red plum flavors and lively acidity at the end. Drink from 2015.

title: Domaines Devillard 2010 Le Renard  (Givry)
description: Light, bright and fruity, this has soft tannins, plenty of red fruits and balancing acidity. Just dry to finish, it is ready to drink now.

title: Joseph Drouhin 2012 Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: Drouhin has significant holdings in a number of top Chambolle vineyards. This wine is a blend from other Premier Crus in the same village. It has the typical generous character along with a more serious structured backbone that gives a dry and solid density that's worth aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2012 Cuvée G Red (Bandol)
description: This is a rich, aromatic and deliciously herbal wine full of structured black fruits and dense tannins that promise aging. Blackberry and plum flavors dominate, giving freshness and ripeness to this full wine. Drink from 2017.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2014 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)
description: The wine is stalky with tight tannins and just a touch of spicy wood. It has acidity, bitter cherry fruits and structure. Drink now.

title: Château la Varière 2011 La Chevalerie Cabernet Sauvignon (Anjou Villages Brissac)
description: Dark in color, this powerful and concentrated wine is still very young. There is possibly too much extraction here that shows in bitterness, but the wine also has the potential for aging with its rich underlying fruitiness. Don't drink before 2015.

title: Louis Bouillot NV Perle de Nuit Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)
description: Warm and rounded wine, with almond flavor and the ripe red fruits to go with the intense and balancing acidity. The wine is rich, while also well textured, giving fine final acidity.

title: Pierre André 2009 Les Forges  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)
description: Benefiting from the ripe 2009 vintage, the wine shows more ripe fruit than is usual from the Hautes-Côtes. It has rich strawberry flavor along with acidity. The soft tannins add a light sense of structure.

title: Domaine Delaporte 2014  Sancerre
description: The wine is young and still firm with dry tannins. It has really fresh red-berry fruits that are going to need time to broaden out. For now, the wine shows the fruitiness of the vintage and with a solid texture for aging. Drink from 2017.

title: Robert Karcher et Fils 2014 Cuvée du Commandeur Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A strangely bitter note mingles with unusually high-toned leafy red-fruit notes. The palate is slightly bitter but dry and fresh. The body is very light. Drink soon.

title: Manuel Olivier 2008 Les Damaudes  (Vosne-Romanée)
description: Dark colored wine, which translates into richness and flavors of full-bodied damsons and plum fruits, with finely judged tannins and wood. Natural power, with concentration and final acidity to give just the right lift.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2015  Sancerre
description: Expanding on their fathers' legacies, the cousins Jean-Laurent and Jean-Dominique Vacheron have a deserving reputation for their almost-Burgundian Sancerre. This latest vintage, packed with both fruit and structure, shows why. It is ripe with red cherries and dark plums laced with acidity. The wine is full of great ripe fruit and generous tannins. Drink from 2018.

title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 La Comme Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: The Domaine, which is based in Santenay, has produced a wine that has structure as well as ripe fruits. The combination promises good aging with the red-plum fruits likely to mellow into a rich concentrated wine. It is a wine to keep and age, and not drink before 2021.

title: Louis Latour 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: The wine is ripe with red-cherry and plum flavors and plenty of acidity to balance. It is a rounded wine, generous with fruitiness and with a touch of tannin at the end. This is a fine village wine from this attractive appellation.

title: Château Deffends 2012 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: Black plum fruits start this wine on a good basis. But the hard tannins and medicinal character are not pleasant. It might improve by 2015.

title: Château Paradis 2010 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This is a wine with good wood aging, a delicious perfumed character and firm tannins. It has weight and richness, with spicy Syrah lending an exotic feel to the wine. Drink from 2016.

title: Domaine Sautereau 2014 Côte de Reigny  (Sancerre)
description: Some barrel aging has given this wine, with its already ripe fruits, extra richness. It is spicy, lifted by juicy acidity from the black cherries and plums. This is a full, warm and ripe wine that is just now ready to drink.

title: Domaine Torraccia 2013 Oriu Réserve de Torraccia Red (Corse Porto Vecchio)
description: Despite its light color, this is a wine for aging. Even now, the tannins are firm and give a dry texture to its red berry fruit. With acidity as well as structure, it's built for powerful meat dishes. Drink from 2018, when the tannins will have softened further.

title: Zusslin 2010 Bollenberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Very textured wine, hinting at fruit that is only just ripe. This light and fragrant wine has red currant fruits and a smoky character. Probably not for aging.

title: Domaine Roumagnac 2012 O Grand R Red (Fronton)
description: Made from the oldest vines on the estate, this ripe and fruity wine is ready to drink. Its tannins are already integrated, leaving a smooth-textured wine that is accompanied by spice and red plum fruit flavors.

title: Louis Jadot 2011 Clos des Gatsulards  (Santenay)
